bible.title: The Parable of the Talents
bible.content: For it will be like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted to them his property. To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one, to each according to his ability. Then he went away. He who had received the five talents went at once and traded with them, and he made five talents more. So also he who had the two talents made two talents more. But he who had received the one talent went and dug in the ground and hid his master's money. Now after a long time the master of those servants came and settled accounts with them. And he who had received the five talents came forward, bringing five talents more, saying, ‘Master, you delivered to me five talents; here, I have made five talents more.’ His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a little; I will set you over much. Enter into the joy of your master.’ And he also who had the two talents came forward, saying, ‘Master, you delivered to me two talents; here, I have made two talents more.’ His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a little; I will set you over much. Enter into the joy of your master.’ He also who had received the one talent came forward, saying, ‘Master, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you scattered no seed, so I was afraid, and I went and hid your talent in the ground. Here, you have what is yours.’ But his master answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant! You knew that I reap where I have not sown and gather where I scattered no seed? Then you ought to have invested my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received what was my own with interest. So take the talent from him and give it to him who has the ten talents. For to everyone who has will more be given, and he will have an abundance. But from the one who has not, even what he has will be taken away. And cast the worthless servant into the outer darkness. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

article.title: The Parable of the Talents: A Story for Kids
article.level_easy: A Master’s Big Surprise! Imagine you are given a bag of treasure! What would you do with it? This is the story of a master who gave his servants something very special... The Servants' Big Test! Once upon a time, a master was going on a long journey. He called three of his servants and gave them something very special—talents! Talents were like bags of treasure. To the first servant, he gave five talents. To the second servant, he gave two talents. And to the third servant, he gave one talent. 'Use these wisely,' the master said, and off he went on his journey. The first servant thought, 'I will use this treasure to earn more!' And he worked hard and doubled his talents. The second servant did the same and doubled his talents too! But the third servant was scared. 'What if I lose the treasure?' he thought. So he dug a hole and hid it in the ground. A Long Time Later... The master came back and called his servants. The first servant said, 'Master, you gave me five talents, and now I have ten!' 'Well done!' said the master. 'You are a good and faithful servant!' The second servant said, 'Master, you gave me two talents, and now I have four!' 'Well done!' said the master. 'You are a good and faithful servant!' But the third servant said, 'Master, I was scared and hid your talent in the ground. Here it is.' The master was not happy. 'You should have at least put it in the bank to earn some interest!' he said. And he gave the talent to the servant with ten talents. The Lesson: This story teaches us that God gives everyone special gifts and skills. We should use them wisely and not hide them away. What will you do with your talents? Remember, God has given YOU something special—go and shine!
